# [[roof]]

===Etymology===
Houses in ancient Japan were dugouts, where the roof came right down to the ground.<ref>[http://japanese.stackexchange.com/questions/32347/why-does-%e5%b1%8b%e6%a0%b9-means-roof-and-%e5%a4%a9%e4%ba%95-means-ceiling-shouldnt-it-be-the-contrary] Why does 屋根 means roof and 天井 means ceiling?</ref>
